opendial.plugins

Class SphinxASR

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.plugins.SphinxASR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module, SpeechRecogniser

    public class SphinxASR
extends java.lang.Object
implements SpeechRecogniser
    Plugin for the CMU Sphinx 4 speech recogniser. Upon recording a new speech stream, the plugin sends the audio data to the recogniser, gets back the recognition results and adds the corresponding input to the dialogue state.

    The plugin requires the specification of a recognition grammar in JSGF format, but can be easily adapted to instead employ a statistical language model. The plugin uses a wideband acoustic model trained on the Wall Street Journal (dictation domain, with microphone speech) and the CMU pronunciation. dictionary. These models can also be straightforwardly changed, depending on the particular needs of the application.

    Version:
    $Date:: $
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • RECOG_PROB

        public static final double RECOG_PROB
        Recognition probability for the best hypothesis returned by Sphinx. This quick and dirty hack is necessary at the moment since it seems difficult to retrieve scored N-Best lists from Sphinx when the language model is grammar-based.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SphinxASR

        public SphinxASR(DialogueSystem system)
          throws DialException
        Creates the module for the Sphinx recognition engine, connected to the dialogue system. The path to the recognition grammar file (in JSGF format) must be specified as parameter in the system settings.
        Parameters:
        system - the dialogue system
        Throws:
        DialException - if the recognition could not be initialised
